question.questionText: Describe how you can tell the difference between the crystals from the calcite test and salt crystals when you observe them in an evaporation dish.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The crystals have different shapes. Salt crystals are square with little Xs. The calcite crystals are shaped like needles (long and skinny).

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Calcite crystals are flaky and salt crystals were not flaky. They are square instead.
Calcite crystals look different than salt crystals.
The mock rock is smelt like flour but the crystals did not.
Crystals are already there so calcite will leave different crystals behind.
